Package org.neo4j.graphalgo.impl.util

Interface PathInterest<P>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PathInterest.PriorityBasedPathInterest, PathInterest.VisitCountBasedPathInterest, PathInterestFactory.AllTolerancePathInterest, PathInterestFactory.PriorityBasedTolerancePathInterest, PathInterestFactory.SingleTolerancePathInterest, PathInterestFactory.VisitCountBasedTolerancePathInterest
    public interface PathInterest<P>
    PathInterest decides if a path is of interest or not in priority based traversal such as Dijkstra or AStar. comparator() provides a comparator on priority object to be used when ordering paths. canBeRuledOut(int, Object, Object)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  PathInterest.PriorityBasedPathInterest<P>  
      static class  PathInterest.VisitCountBasedPathInterest<P>

      Decide if a traversal branch with numberOfVisits, pathPriority and oldPriority (based on end node) can be ruled out from further traversal or not.
      Comparator<P> comparator()

    • Method Detail

      • comparator

        Comparator<P> comparator()
        Returns:
        Comparator to use when ordering in priority map

      • canBeRuledOut

        boolean canBeRuledOut​(int numberOfVisits,
                      P pathPriority,
                      P oldPriority)
        Decide if a traversal branch with numberOfVisits, pathPriority and oldPriority (based on end node) can be ruled out from further traversal or not.
        Parameters:
        numberOfVisits - number of times a traversal branch ending on the same node has been traversed from.
        pathPriority - priority of traversal branch currently considered.
        oldPriority - priority of other traversal branch.
        Returns:
        true if traversal branch can be ruled out from further traversal, false otherwise.

      • stillInteresting

        boolean stillInteresting​(int numberOfVisits)
        Decide if a traversal branch that previously has not been ruled out still is interesting. This would typically mean that a certain number of paths are of interest.
        Parameters:
        numberOfVisits -
        Returns:
        true if traversal branch still is of interest

      • stopAfterLowestCost

        boolean stopAfterLowestCost()
        Should traversal stop when traversed beyond lowest cost?
        Returns:
        true if traversal should stop beyond lowest cost.
